Uses of Class
eea.engine.component.Component

Packages that use Component
eea.engine.action This package provides the default interface for actions. 
eea.engine.action.basicactions This package provides a set of default basic actions that modify objects. 
eea.engine.component This package provides the abstract classes for components. 
eea.engine.component.render This package provides the concrete implementation for renderable components. 
eea.engine.entity This package provides the two base classes for entities. 
eea.engine.event This package provides the generic event classes in the eea framework. 
eea.engine.event.basicevents This package provides a set of basic events for use in the eea framework. 
 

Uses of Component in eea.engine.action

 void Action.update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb, int delta, Component event)
          Any action has to implement the update method.

Uses of Component in eea.engine.component
 

Subclasses of Component in eea.engine.component
 class RenderComponent
          A RenderComponent is an abstract component that is used as a base for all game entities that can be rendered (shown on the game screen).
 

Uses of Component in eea.engine.component.render
 

Subclasses of Component in eea.engine.component.render
 class AnimationRenderComponent
          An AnimationRenderComponent is a renderable (displayable) component that can be animated with a given animation speed.
 class ImageRenderComponent
          A RenderComponent that is represented by an image
 

Uses of Component in eea.engine.entity
 

Methods in eea.engine.entity that return Component
 Component Entity.getEvent(java.lang.String id)
          returns first the component (if any) with the given ID from the list of associated components for this entity
 

Methods in eea.engine.entity with parameters of type Component
 void Entity.addComponent(Component event)
          Adds a new event to this entity.
 void Entity.removeComponent(Component componentToRemove)
          removes a given component from this event, if it was included.
 

Uses of Component in eea.engine.event
 

Subclasses of Component in eea.engine.event
 class ANDEvent
          Multiple events can be combined using a logical conjunction (AND).
 class Event
          An event describes something that "happened", for example, a collision between two objects, mouse or keyboard actions.
 class OREvent
          Multiple events can be combined using a logical disjunction (OR).
 

Uses of Component in eea.engine.event.basicevents
 

Subclasses of Component in eea.engine.event.basicevents
 class CollisionEvent
          This event checks if the entity owning the event has collided with a different entity
 class KeyDownEvent
          This event represents the user currently pressing ("down") a key on the keyboard
 class KeyPressedEvent
          This event represents the user has just released ("pressed") a key on the keyboard
 class LeavingScreenEvent
          This event represents cases where the owning entity of the event is just in the process of leaving (the displayable part of) the screen.
 class LoopEvent
          This special type of event ensures that the action(s) associated with the event will always occur, thus providing an "endless loop":
 class MouseClickedEvent
          This type of event will cause all associated action(s) to perform if the user has clicked the left mouse button.
 class MouseEnteredEvent
          This event represents cases where the mouse position matches the area occupied by the entity owning this event
 class MovementDoesNotCollideEvent
          This event represents cases where the movement of the entity owning the entity does not collide with any other entity
